rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Such an intelligent man.  Gives excellent feedback on papers and his lectures are brilliant.  Can't wait to take another class with him.

His lectures are really long and dragged out. He uses confusing and complicated diction and unnecessary comments. I learned most from recitation (recommend Melanie Ungar if she's still there). One group project, a few short papers, and two exams (midterm and final). MUST DO THE READINGS!!

Fantastic professor. Welcoming but somewhat intimidating in office hours: he doesn't just hand stuff to his students. Overall, the best class and professor I have had so far at Chapel Hill. He really knows his stuff, including topics that it seems wouldn't be his main field. Excellent feedback on papers. Careful, precise, and flexible instructor.

Sat in front of the room and had a conversation with the other prof, mostly about how difficult the subject material was. Made no effort to make the material understandable. If you visited him in his office, even with an appointment, he practically pushed you out the door as soon as you walked in. Has NO interest in helping struggling students.
Eric Downing is the reason I am a comparative literature major.  He is EXCELLENT!!!
Professor Downing was by far the best literature teacher I've had at UNC.  I loved his verbosity!
he can be a bit verbose, but the assignments were easy and he was very helpful and easy to get in contact with.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Amazing professor. If you go to class and take advantage of office hours you'll do well. Expectations are very clear, lectures are interesting and engaging. Best professor I've had at unc.

Absolutely amazing professor! He is always there for his students! However, his FYS was a very difficult class. Expect many hard papers, 300 pages of reading a week, and a very difficult final project. Although it was hard, his willingness to help and clarify made it all a really rewarding experience. I learned a lot and he makes boring things cool

Good professor. His lectures are very clear and easy to follow. It is easy to take notes in his class. The downside is all the reading, and the way it is split up. Sometimes you read 2 pages in a weekend and sometimes you read 300- just depends on the particular topic. He goes over readings in class though! I only did 1st half of  readings -got B+

This class was one of the best that I have had at UNC. The lectures discussed the important points from the readings, and engages the class within the subject. The discussion sections reinforced the topics that were needed for the class, but he had good TAs. If you ever need him, he is more than willing to talk to you. An overall awesome professor.
He lays out every lesson very clearly; the content of the course is easy to follow.  Very interesting class, but there is quite a bit of reading.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She's chill and okay. She doesn't like it when you have a different opinion then herself but if you write what she wants to hear in essays then you'll do fine. And speak up- she's not the harshest about participation but it does matter

Took CMPL 240 (Film Analysis) with Pollmann and I won't take another film class. She's extremely smart, but the lectures are long and the class is very analytical (but you must share her views).  She's not very clear in her expectations and assigned a 10-12 page paper with numerous prompts. Required to watch a film every week and only enjoyed 4.

Her lectures provide a lot of insight into the films we watched. She is pretty low-key, though had us do some dense readings. She asked us to answer questions on them, but mostly to guide our reading. Seems like a tough grader, but is easier and more understanding than. Is willing to focus discussions on what the class is interested in

I took this class for Germ 303, which is normally just a German Lit class, but she has actually re-structured it so that you spend half of the semester focusing on literature and the other half on German film. There's no textbook, but you do have reading and written assignments due every class. I enjoyed it and my German improved substantially

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Pichova is really sweet and takes the time to give individual feedback to each and every student for papers. You have to be decent at writing to do well though. Overall just show up most of the time and write the papers and read/skim the books and you'll get an A
Pichova is extremely nice and helpful.

My 2nd class with Pichova; she carefully chooses readings and helps you analyze and understand them. My non-lit-major friends had a hard time with her grading, b/c there are 2 essay tests and a paper. But she's hilarious and wants you to do well, and creates a great class atmosphere for discussion. If you're into lit/slavic things, take her class!

Such a sweetheart! Classes set up kind of like a book club: she does a close reading of the text and anyone can chime in when they want (but she also doesn't care if you don't talk). Reading is very manageable and interesting. She is hilarious and brilliant and always willing to talk outside of class. Read and pay attention and you will be fine.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Good professor, but his attitude seems to be dependent on his mood. I was surprised to find him to be gruff/impatient in office hours. Also, I heard him and the TA's's loudly talk about me once. Decent student/make good grades, so Im not deserving of smack talk. If you want a professional instructor and not a Regina George incarnation, avoid.

Fantastic professor. Get ready to start participating because he always makes sure to include everyone in the discussions. He keeps the topics current and interesting, and is very passionate and enthusiastic. Good deal of reading and homework and it isn't an easy class, but it's worth it. Work hard and your German will see a sure improvement.

Really great professor and person in general. I was frustrated with my vocabulary, and he could tell. I got a spontaneous email one day from him explaining the struggles he had with learning german. He constantly offers to meet with you to practice german. Unlike most german profs he makes lecture comfortable instead of a game of russian roullette.

Fantastic! Engaging, cusses like a sailor, passionate about German philosophy. Must keep up with the readings, writing assignments, and lecture classes. If you show up, turn in assignments, and study 3-4 hours per test, you're golden. More than willing to get coffee with students. One of the most accessible professors I have had. Love him!

Langston is the man!  He's so enthusiastic about teaching and is really down-to-earth and cool.  Even in a huge lecture hall, he makes an effort to involve the class in discussions about 20th c. German philosophy.  Do the readings, keep up with the homework, and you'll do fine.  I'm definitely going to take another class with Langston.
Assigns a good amount of reading, but overall a great professor. Makes class entertaining, and definitely worth the workload.
great prof

I took Dr. Langston's Avant-Garde Cinema first-year seminar class and was absolutely delighted. :) He was very energetic and placed a lot of emphasis on getting to know each student individually. There was a fair bit of reading in this class, but not enough to be overwhelming. Recitations were pretty long to accommodate the films we watched.

Dick is a great professor and knows his stuff. He is a nice guy and will help you out if you need it. And contrary to the previous post the German Department at UNC is great. If you are a major of one of the gigantic departments where you have no contact with faculty being a German major is a great change.
No Comments
one of the best professors i've ever had
the german department sucks.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Pike was by far the best professor I had in my first semester at UNC. He is a true thinker, very witty, and his topics of discussion are engaging. Prof. Pike grades very fairly (the class was an easy A). The class is discussion-based, though verbal participation in discussion is by no means required. Prof. Pike respects opposing views.

Great guy, cool car, nice shoes, endless knowledge about Dictators and their Defenders. Always has sweet memorabilia to show the class. I would go to Vegas with this teacher, he is that cool. Great Class,would recommend to anyone.

One of the nicest and most intelligent professors. If you pay attention in the course, it is very interesting. A very fair grader. Expect a lot of emails  from him. He likes to ramble in the class as well as in emails. He does have a final now, but it's not too hard as long as you've read the most of the articles he sends and watch the videos.

I took his FYS and it was very interesting and easy. He knows A LOT and can talk about current events forever. I mostly did other homework in that class and he didn't seem to mind. There is only one midterm paper and one final paper which are easy. Just make sure that it is a paper written by a college student not a high school student...

I really enjoyed his class. But if you aren't interested to begin with, you aren't going to get anything out of it. It's very interesting if you actually do listen to what he says, but he does tend to ramble on forever. He's a fair grader and you wouldn't make less than a B in his class.
He talks talks talks and talks. you will never get anytihng belowe a B. if u try then u will definately get an A. I didnt do $h!t in that class and still got a B+
Rambles...but he's a nice guy and a fair grader
Awesome Guy...yeah sure he rambles but he's fair and he's funny.

oh my dear lord most boring class ive ever had in my entire life. tons of reading..but dont bother doin them b/c there's no tests..just 2 papers on whatever you feel like writing about. no final. if u want a super easy class that will bore you to death, sign on up
Borring...horribly borring...managed to spend an entire semester in his first year semininar without learning A SINGLE THING. Wish that I would have dropped...

One of the best professors I've ever had. Interesting, really intelligent guy. Makes interesting connections between past and present events. I loved this class, and I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes.
so boring... rambles... makes me want to stab myself in the forehead... every second of this class is an eternity of mind numbing pain

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is the bee's knees. She will certainly pique your interest in the Russian language and culture. She cares for her students and is very passionate about teaching. Take Russian with her!!!

SHE IS SO GREAT!  SO funny and soooo nice! Willing to help you whenever you need it! Genuinely cares about all of her students! Study for the tests and they are not very hard. I'm terrible at any and all foreign languages and I did very well in RUSS 101. Take her class!
She is absolutely amazing, I lover her and wish I could have her for every class at UNC.  She makes the material fun to learn, and her personality can't be beat

Eleonora is the best professor at UNC! She is really funny and is a lenient grader. She understands if you are busy and will push back quizzes and tests for you. If you have a chance to take Russ 101 with her do it!
Excellent teacher who constantly makes you laugh. Not an easy class but definitely worth taking, she wants you to succeed.

Love Eleanora! Specifically signed up for her class cos I'd heard good things about her. She's funny & will help you if you struggle. She calls on students regularly, so you have to pay attention. HW is to be handed in every lesson, which got old fast lol. She grades very generously though. Found her class very worthwhile & made my semester shine.

Eleonora is highly entertaining and engaging. I absolutely love her! I really enjoy going to this class and she is very understanding about circumstances keeping you from class. She is very willing to help you with material outside of class. Genuinely excited about the material.
Absolutely loved her. One of the best professors I've had in any subject! Hilarious and extremely fun. Pretty easy class too.
She is a little crazy, but very entertaining. I've never had a professor who cares so much about her students!

Eleonora is the most amazing teacher!  She's hilarious and sweet and really cares about the material.  If you're having any trouble, she's more than willing to help you.  The best teacher and I highly highly recommend her!  She makes Russian so much fun!
Great professor, great class!  Highly recommend!
Very entertaining and funny in class.  Keeps you engaged.  Very helpful outside of class if you don't understand the material.  She's very sweet and just an interesting person in general.
Probably one of the most interesting characters in the Slavic Studies Department.  Anyone who has the chance to take a class with her should.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Very interesting professor, very intelligent and really knows everything there is to know about languages, linguistics, Scandinavia, old Norse, and the Viking age. Definitely have to do the readings to do well, and tests and papers are worth a lot so you have to do well or else you won't do well. Class is kind of boring but recitations  are good.

Sociolinguistics was incredibly fun. Not only is the topic itself interesting, but Roberge managed to engage the class. His tests were straight forward. So long as you came to class and paid attention, you did well. Going to his office hours helps a lot. He answers questions and is happy to work with you.

Very interesting course. He was very enthusiastic and the reading was good, although it was quite a bit per week. He's tests are fill-in-the-blank and essay questions, and as long as you answer the question and provided decent details it was ok. Recommend going to office hours and talking to him. He is very open and will help you.

Roberge is probably the most understanding professor I've had. As long as you try to do your best (coming to class, going to his office hours upon occasion) he will reciprocate your effort with understanding and grace.

I took a Language Change class with him. He was once an editor, which means he will edit the heck out of anything that crosses his path. It's very eye-opening but difficult to follow him down his many digressions.
I took an Early Germanic Culture Seminar with Paul, and had a great time! He was helpful and friendly, although we did use powerpoint quite a lot. He helped de-fog some difficult early texts.

Roberge is a stickler for scholarly accuracy, and this will soon become very apparent in his overly-detailed explanations and qualifications for EVERYTHING said in class. Class discussion was for the most part unheard of, murdered us with enormously drawn out powerpoint sessions every day.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: This class changed my life. Super easy (most kids didn't read at all and still got A's and B's) but you will learn so much if you do the readings. Gabriel is brilliant and leads a very interesting, nontypical lifestyle that is fascinating to hear about when he does share.

very easy-goingnice guy,  really great at teaching, gives a lot of feedback.. definitely would recommend. you have to do a lot of reading for this class and have homework almost every class plus three papers, but overall i don't think the course was too hard.

If you take a deep interest into Literature, he will talk with you in his office hours for as long as you want and furnish you with as many things as you would like.  He is really knowledgeable in multiple areas. For anyone just wanting to learn intro language, he is very clear and will make sure to help you understand something if you are trying.

Herr Trop is an awesome guy who I'd recommend to anyone taking German classes at UNC. I had him for both 302 which is more culture and sociologically based and also 303 which is literature. You can definitely tell he's in his element with literature, he's a really smart guy and also laid back and easy going as a professor. Definitely a cool guy

Awesome guy.  Really lenient, and actually cares about getting you to learn German.  He's also pretty funny, and is quick to respond to emails. Overall awesome dude who I would kill to have to any German class.
Funny, clear, doesn't have an accent.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I absolutely loved Ruth von Bernuth. She is probably one of the smartest women I have ever met in my life. I would totally take any of her classes again. If you care about learning German as well as German CultureHistory, this is the professor you need to see.

avoid at all costs. this is the most insensitive professor i have ever had. I was .2 points away from getting an A and she denied me. Furthermore I am completely fluent in German, as I used to live there, thus I saw no reason why my oral exam grade was a -B. She didnt even care enough about the class to learn our names. RUN AWAY.

Don't be scared off by Dr. von Bernuth's seemingly intensive class at first. Yes, she speaks a lot of German and moves at a fairly fast pace however she is EXTREMELY  helpful, caring, and really wants her students to learn. She is one of the best professors I have had at UNC.  Make sure you visit her in her office hours!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: This was Dr. Prica's first semester at UNC and I loved her. She is so sweet and really cares about the work she assigns. I only took her class for the three gen-eds, but it was still interesting. You have one midterm and a final test, but you have three 5-6 page papers, but she grades easily. She also takes attendance and grades on participation.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is very good professor.  Always gives good feedback, but she is very serious about plagiarism. All the work checked by plagramme  plagiarism checker.

Wegel is the best professor I have ever had!!! I LOVE HER! She is absolutely hilarious and couldn't be more helpful when you ask. I will try to take as many classes as possible with her.  Participation and homework are huge percentages of the grade, so although tests are mediocre, it is still really easy to get an A.  Lots of grades, which is nice.

Awesome professor and very interesting class. I learned a lot from her. Definitely reccommend. Expect homework and usually reading every night. Mid-term, final, 3-4 quizzes and 4 papers. The hard work is worth it for sure, and she will help you improve your German.

Dr. Wegel is an overall amazing professor, even though the course readings are often "sehr langweilig" and definitely a little weird. She really wants students to succeed and tries to grade according to amount of effort rather than correctness. The class itself only had a midterm and a final which was a lot different for me. A+ professor.

I have taken two classes with Dr. Wegel, German 301 and 302, and both have been great. As head of the department, she is the preeminent German  instructor at UNC. Do whatever you can to get in a class with her (but if you have the choice, R. Langston is really, really great as well). Assignments clear, super nice grader.

If you have any choice in the matter, take your German course with Frau Dr. Wegel: laid back, funny, and (most importantly) the fairest grader of them all. The 203 format has a ton of homework, but realistically, effort is being gradedâ??not mastery.
Excellent professor, great class. Super friendly and willing to help out side of class.

One of the best teachers I've ever had.  Funny and smart and really interested in helping the students learn to appreciate the subject matter as much as she does.  I'd definitely recommend a course by her.
Excellent teacher! She's very helpful and I'd recommend any of her classes highly. There is quite a bit of homework, but it's not unmanageable.
Awesome professor! Great class! Wish I could take it over just for fun. :)A few pop quizzes that are only hard if you don't do the homework.

A really cool german teacher.  She is german of course, and is really friendly.  There is quite a bit of HW for 301, but its easy, jsut time consuming.  I recommend the class a lot.  She makes the class fun through the readings and listening to music and watching videos.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Stas is very knowledgeable about the material, but his lecture style leaves something to be desired. Classes are the best when he just talks about the material--he speaks beautifully, but is not the best at stimulating class discussion, which is where his classes fall flat. He is often vague about what is expected of his students.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Had him for Chekhov. Lapushin is the bomb. Super easy grader and fantastic, interesting lectures. If you ever get the chance to take a class with him DO IT. One of the best professors at UNC.

Hands-down, one of the best professors I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. I took one class with him my third semester at Carolina and took another my fourth and fifth semesters here! He inspired me to change my major to Russian and Slavic Language and Culture and has been there to guide me every step of the way! Take a class with him!

I had Lapushin for a first year seminar, Madness and (Russian) Lit. Class is almost entirely discussion-based with only a little bit of highly informal lecture. By the end of the semester I was wishing he would lecture more because he is SO GOOD at it--he is engaging and inspiring. Also, he's very easy at least in a FYS. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Really passionate about the subject. Helpful, enthusiastic, and engaging. Take his class!
Awesome prof - dedicated, enthusiastic, very russian :) class was a joy
The best professor at UNC.
So enthusiastic and entertaining! Lots of reading, but he never gives reading quizzes. Not the easiest paper grader, but not too difficult and he offers help

Professor Lapushin is the hidden jem of UNC. He is the best professor I've ever had. His passion and excitement for what he teaches makes every class worth attending just so you can hear him talk. Sometimes he'll act out scenes from what we're reading and drop to his knees. He is super nice and really wants his students to do well. Take his classes

Read the other reviews. Lapushin is the best professor at UNC, bar none. He sometimes has a habit of talking over students, but only because he gets so excited over books. He's like one of those professors from movies that ends up changing your perspective on the world. Take a class with this man before you graduate. And UNC: tenure this man!

Easily one of the best professors I have had at UNC.  I'm a math major, but after taking a russian literature class from Professor Lapushin, I have a genuine interest in the subject.  Lapushin makes virtually every reading fascinating.  He is also an incredibly nice and helpful person.

Great professor.  His passion for books and reading is infectious.  He helps you to see and understand literature in completely new ways.  He's also genuinely a nice person and concerned with every student's performance in the class.  Take him!
The best professor I've ever had.
Simply put, he is the man.

Absolutely phenomenal professor.  I don't care what your major is, don't leave Carolina without taking a course with this man.  He is brilliant, helpful, and extremely funny.  Russian literature comes to life when he's at the helm.  In fact, just let Lapushin teach everything.

I LOVE THIS MAN! he is funny, very passionate, and really makes us get down to the bottom of the question during class discussions. always pushes us to understand the text better. there are only two papers and two exams, the rest is reading and discussion. oh, and prepare for the best Russian accent you will ever hear.

One of the funniest and intelligent professors ever.  He truly knows exactly what he's talking about and is ALWAYS available to help out if you feel you need it at all.  He's got great passion for Russian Literature and will truly help you enjoy the subject matter!!
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: One of the best teachers you'll ever have.
Loves to quote Pushkin. Makes class enjoyable. About the same amount of homework as 101102. However, more is expected from exams.

Awesome language professor. Gets technical with his explanations at times, but is clear, helpful, and attentive. Comes off as strict, but is actually kind of hilarious. If you take the class seriously and don't miss lectures, you'll do well.
Prof Reese is the ideal language teacher. His expectations are very clear and he is strict but fair. If you are serious about the class, you will get a lot out of it.

He is very passionate about the subject and committed to sharing that passion with the students. Although he occasionally gets distracted by minor details in the text, he is a great instructor and I thoroughly enjoyed the course.
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Good class if you're into philosophy; easier if you can read the original German texts. Definitely not a good class to take for your PH credit. He makes an effort to post many course materials online though, which saves a lot of money.

He's an entertaining lecturer, and the class is pretty straightforward. I got away with not doing most readings, but I never skipped lectures. The papers are graded harsh, but the tests are all multiple choice. It's a lot of work and the writings are really dry, but it's not impossible. The tests contain mostly lecture and recitation material.

Frequently lectures on only a very small portion of the very significant assigned readings. He didn't really know much about Marx, which was disappointing, but still managed to avoid most major errors. Tests are all multiple-choice (and papers count very little) and when not very tricky, are on useless information. TAs make those though, I believe.
Interesting class, but difficult. TAs and recitation very important for understanding and comprehending course material.

An odd one to evaluate. He lives in large lecture  halls, so it's impossible to get to know him. He's a big name in his field. I was reading a Mann story the other day and noticed he was the translator. He's a decent teacher, if aloof. It is fun to hear him translate from Latin, Ancient Greek, German, and French though. Warning: he will curve DOWN!

I don't recommend him unless you're especially interested in philosophy.  The exams are relatively difficult, though not impossible.  He's not always so clear and it's hard to anticipate what will be on them.  Not to mention he curved our first exam grades DOWN.

Great lecturer, has a knack for making very difficult subject matter easier to understand. Its a good thing, for most people german philosophy is pretty hard to understand. Grades are run by TAs- can be pretty hit or miss (mine was fine). I worked hard but don't regret taking the class.

Very interesting professor, knows a lot about his subject. The lectures are very interesting, but it's your job to keep on top of them. Don't be expected to be handed everything on a silver platter. Also, don't fall back on your readings. The TAs aren't that great, they try to do their thing and it doesn't work. Highly recommended class.
He makes boring stuff fairly interesting!

Witty, insightful and wonderful at condensing and clarifying material in lecture, but..lectures and reading don't correspond with each other, paper topics are poorly defined, and TAs are inept. It's extremely frustrating experience, but the class is actually not that hard.

There is no discussion in class; he shows up late, lectures, and leaves five minutes early.  He has unattainable standards regarding what constitutes "H" work, and he doesn't stick to those standards.  Otherwise, this is really not a graduate caliber course.  An easy, albeit frustrating, "P" course.

The material on the tests was unexpected by most of the students and the recitation leaders did little to help.  The lectures were good and clarified the readings well, however, the tests seemed to contain some rather trivial, unexpected questions which made studying difficult.

You read one thing, he teaches another, and you're tested on a third.  He does not hold office hours and the recitation leaders do little to help.  The tests are interpretive but are multiple choice so you can't justify your answer.  Horrible class and professor.
lectures really help clarify some of the dense readings, and he throws in a few funny comments along the way. there's a good bit of reading, but you learn a lot.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Really fun and passionate about Dutch culture.  He is extremely helpful, but requires a lot of speaking in class.  Don't be shy about reading aloud or asking for help though!
BEST dressed professor on campus. Do they have an award for this? Amazingly awesome teacher. He rocks. I can't wait to go to the Netherlands now.
Very friendly and enthusiastic.
Amazing, knowledgeable, worldly teacher, really has a passion for the Dutch culture, open to ideas and overall just a great guy.

This guy is awesome. I learned a lot about the Dutch language and culture. He's really nice, easygoing, and funny. I definitely recommend taking a class by him. If you don't understand something he's very patient and willing to help you until you definitely know it. Awesome guy. I can't say that enough.
